alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 13 at 8:20PM MST until August 13 at 11:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County near Yarnell in west central Arizona... * Until 1130 PM MST. * At 818 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the area from Yarnell to just west of Peeples Valley. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible just west of Yarnell. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Peeples Valley, Yarnell and Glen Ilah. This includes the following highways... State Route 89 between mile markers 269 and 283. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Miller Creek, Antelope Creek, North Fork Date Creek, Bland Creek, Waterman Creek, Poplar Wash, Model Creek, Martinez Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Kirkland Creek and Yarnell Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
